conclusion: Use the ideal gas law and relation between states on a p-V diagram.
Process from B to C is isothermal, so T_B = T_C = 300 K.
States A, B, and C are on the p-V diagram.
State A: p_A ≈ 3 x 10^3 Pa, V_A ≈ 3 x 10^-3 m³.
State B: p_B ≈ 2 x 10^3 Pa, V_B ≈ 5 x 10^-3 m³.
State C: p_C ≈ 5 x 10^3 Pa, V_C ≈ 1 x 10^-3 m³.
Apply ideal gas law between states A and B: (p_AV_A)/T_A = (p_BV_B)/T_B.
Assume process from A to B follows an ideal gas process; state B is at lower pressure and larger volume than state C.
Use process from B to C directly since state C is isothermal.
Since temperature remains constant during isothermal process (B to C), T_B = 300 K.
Temperature of gas in state B is 300 K.
